channel.title: Overview on ASPLOS'22 Tutorial
channel.description: Recent content in Overview on ASPLOS'22 Tutorial

item.title: Introduction to Unikraft
item.description: This initial introduction provides a birds-eye view of Unikraft through a short-presentation. In this presentation, we go over the basics of unikernels, their purpose and the motivation behind building unikernels with the library Operating System model. Expected time 15mn.

item.title: Getting started with Unikraft
item.description: Basic working (configure, build, run) with Unikraft and kraft. Expected time 60mn.

item.title: Inside the Config and Build System
item.description: We take a look inside Unikraft internals - its build system and runtime infrastructure. Expected time 60mn.

item.title: Running complex applications
item.description: We will run full-fledged applications on top of Unikraft (nginx, redis, sqlite). Expected time 60mn.

item.title: Syscall Shim and Binary Compatibility Layer
item.description: We use the syscall shim layer to run unmodified (binary) applications. Expected time 60mn.

item.title: High performance applications
item.description: We explore how we can create high performance application over Unikraft. Expected time 60mn.

item.title: Unikernels: Paths to Production & Current Research Trends
item.description: We go through current research and development tracks in the Unikraft project. Expected time 30mn.

item.title: People
item.description: This tutorial is co-organized by Hugo Lefeuvre (The University of Manchester), Felipe Huici (NEC Laboratories Europe GmbH), Răzvan Deaconescu (University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest), Pierre Olivier (The University of Manchester), Alexander Jung (Lancaster University), Vlad-Andrei Bădoiu (University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest), and Cristian Vijelie (University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest). Over the last decade we co-authored numerous libOS/unikernel papers: ClickOS (NSDI’14), LightVM (SOSP’17), Hermitux (VEE’19, IEEE TC'21), Unikraft (EuroSys’21), among others.
